review_blob:
Got this brew on tap, poured in a tulip glass at Brix in Greeley, CO. 

Yellow-gold in color. Very cloudy, hazy, not at all transparent. Good carbonation with lively bubbles rising from the bottom of the glass and nice lacing.

Very pleasant aroma, fruity, sweet, hints of floral and spices.

Lively, crisp mouthfeel. Sweet, complex flavor with a yummy Belgian funk.

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this beer & would definitely have it again!

Poured from 11.2 oz. bottle into a Sam Adams lager glass.

Appearance: Thick, creamy, long-lasting head. Rich, clear amber color with no particles apparent. Moderate to significant lacing. Each swallow stirs up a noticeable amount of carbonation/bubbles in the glass.

Aroma: Sweet and malty

Mouthfeel: Medium body and moderate carbonation

Taste: Fairly sweet, bready, malty hints of caramel. Lingering hoppy bitterness on the back of the tongue after swallowing.

Overall, pretty tasty. Id gladly have another!

Poured a 12 oz. bottle into a pilsner glass.

Appearance: Creamy head was short-lived. Fizzy sound -- like pouring a soda in a glass. Little to no lacing. Mild streaming carbonation coming up from the bottom of the glass. Dark brown cola color that has a nice red tint when held to the light.

Aroma: Nice toasty barley smell. Slight hint of coffee aroma.

Mouthfeel: Medium body with moderate carbonation on the tongue.

Taste: Presents with a nice rich malty flavor. Some sweetness reminiscent of prunes or raisins (but not cloying or overpowering, just a hint) Slight hoppy bitterness on the finish.

Overall: A very pleasant, drinkable beer.
